title: 1964 Westfalia Splitscreen Camper van - 50 years old!*SOLD*

posts.content:
1964 Westfalia VW Splitscreen Campervan – This bus is 50 years old!!! - Full 12 months MOT

This bus has a rare SO34 Westfalia camping interior with the original flip front seat and a factory fitted extractor fan, factory fitted seat belts and the rare white version interior finish (which I think was for one year only)

BOB (PRX7 B)
Model 231 VW Combi - 11 windows
Left hand drive
Built in Germany on 06.01.1964
First registered in the UK on 24.05.2001
Green and white - both VW colours, white is Casablanca VW Y9G
It was originally all green 52 37 03 lichtgrau
New VW1600 twin port engine (not recon) less than 2000miles
12 VOLT
New clutch 2010, fitted by Luke at Terry’s Beetles, London
Gear box 1303/2 Beetle
Bay front beam 1968
Lowered creative engineering front beam adjusters fitted
IRS fitted to rear
New brakes less that 2000miles
Disc Front Drum Rear
Waxoiled undersealed

S034 Westfalia camping interior with internal extractor
- factory fitted (very rare)
Option /extra factory code 361/056/119/215
Original front Flip Seat
Safari windows (creative engineering)
Two pop out windows
Submarine hatch
Original camping table and vanity unit
SO42 pop up table door unit
roof rack - 1x westy front small repro
Protex Gas heater
Immobiliser
Stereo with 10 cd changer
Original documents and all receipts for work done
Safe fitted
Tax Exempt
Full 12 Months MOT
£15,250 - Price reduced for quick sale, no offers
Contact Robert on 07500 898939

The bus also comes with some extra's - awning/tent (Modern) original windscreens, new door rubbers, odds and sods

With the rare front flip seat it has meant that in the past we have been able to seat 6 adults for dinner in the rain, and having the factory fitted extractor enables the kitchen to swivel inwards and so we can cook inside in bad weather or with the back open in good.

Met the chap (Guy) that imported the van into the UK in 2000 and he gave me a little bit of history about the bus, it was originally owned by the German Government and it was used to monitor and test air pollution (smog) and he thinks that this is why it had the factory fitted extractor which is normally only seen on the ambulances.

Very reluctant sale as this van has travelled with us all around Europe and was our home when we first found our new
